trans-unit.source: Activates SOAP-enabled COM+ application proxies from a client.
ClrObjectFactory is used internally by the .NET Framework.
You do not need to use the class directly in your code.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory"></xref> class.
Activates a remote assembly through .NET remoting, using the assembly's configuration file.
The name of the assembly to activate.
The name of the type to activate.
Not used.
An instance of the that represents the type, with culture, arguments, and binding and activation attributes set to , or if the TypeName parameter is not found.
A caller in the call chain does not have permission to access unmanaged code.
The class is not registered.
Activates a remote assembly through .NET remoting, using the remote assembly's mailbox.
Currently not implemented; throws a <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException> if called.
Throws an exception if called.
A mailbox on the Web service.
Not used.
This method throws an exception if called.
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is not implemented.
Activates a remote assembly through .NET remoting, using the virtual root URL of the remote assembly.
CreateFromVroot appends the string "?wsdl" to `VrootUrl` and calls <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ClrObjectFactory.CreateFromWsdl%2A> to activate the remote object.
The version of SOAP used by .NET remoting is RPC/encoded, not document/literal, which is required for SOAP interoperability.
Therefore, CreateFromVroot will not work with most ASMX Web services.
CreateFromVroot requires administrative privileges on the local computer the first time it is run, because it creates and installs a client proxy for communication with the remote assembly.
The virtual root URL of the object to be activated.
Not used.
An instance of the representing the type, with culture, arguments, and binding and activation attributes set to , or if the assembly identified by the VrootUrl parameter is not found.
A caller in the call chain does not have permission to access unmanaged code.
The thread token could not be opened.
Activates a remote assembly through .NET remoting, using the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) of the XML Web service.
Processes the WSDL passed in and, if necessary, generates a proxy, then activates the remote object.
The version of SOAP used by .NET remoting is RPC/encoded, not document/literal, which is required for SOAP interoperability.
Therefore, CreateFromWsdl will not work with most ASMX Web services.
CreateFromWsdl requires administrative privileges on the local computer the first time it is run, because it creates and installs a client proxy for communication with the remote assembly.
The WSDL URL of the Web service.
Not used.
An instance of the representing the type, with culture, arguments, and binding and activation attributes set to , or if the assembly identified by the WsdlUrl parameter is not found.
A caller in the call chain does not have permission to access unmanaged code.
The thread token could not be opened.
